Job Title: Mobile App Developer (React Native & Flutter – Full Stack)Location: Hyderabad, IndiaWork Mode: Work From Office (WFO)Experience: Minimum 3 YearsEmployment Type: Full-TimeJob Summary:We are seeking a skilled and passionate Mobile App Developer proficient in React Native and Flutter with strong hands-on experience in both front-end and back-end development. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable and high-performing mobile applications across iOS and Android platforms.Key Responsibilities:* Design, develop, test, and deploy cross-platform mobile applications using React Native and Flutter.* Build and integrate back-end services/APIs using Node.js, Firebase, or other backend technologies.* Collaborate with UI/UX designers and backend teams to deliver seamless user experiences.* Optimize application performance, memory usage, and responsiveness.* Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the application.* Maintain and enhance existing apps; fix bugs and implement new features.* Write clean, maintainable, and scalable code following industry best practices.* Stay up to date with new mobile technology trends, applications, and protocols.Technical Skills Required:* **Front-End:** React Native, Flutter, Redux/ MobX , Dart, JavaScript, TypeScript.* **Back-End:** Node.js, Firebase, MongoDB, MySQL, RESTful APIs, GraphQL.* **DevOps/Tools:** Git, Postman, VS Code, Android Studio/Xcode, CI/CD pipelines.* Strong knowledge of mobile architecture, design patterns (MVC, MVVM), and secure coding practices.* Familiarity with publishing apps to the **Google Play Store** and **Apple App Store**.Qualifications & Requirements:* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.* Minimum 3 years of proven experience in mobile application development with React Native & Flutter.* Experience in end-to-end development – from UI to API integration and backend management.* Strong debugging and performance tuning skills.* Excellent communication and team collaboration abilities. Preferred:* Experience with third-party libraries and APIs integration (e.g., payment gateways, maps, analytics).* Knowledge of native development (Java/Kotlin for Android, Swift for iOS) is a plus.* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies.📩 Apply NowSend your resume to deepika.g@nybinfotech.com🔁 Feel free to share or tag someone who fits this role!hashtag#Hiring hashtag#MobileDeveloper hashtag#ReactNative hashtag#Flutter hashtag#JavaScript hashtag#HyderabadJobs hashtag#ImmediateJoiners hashtag#experience hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#mongoDB

A Kubernetes project typically involves containerizing an application and deploying it on a Kubernetes cluster for better scalability, resilience, and automation. For example, consider a microservices-based e-commerce platform. The project begins by creating Docker images for each microservice (like user, cart, product, and payment). These images are pushed to a container registry.Next, Kubernetes manifests such as Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, and Ingress are written. Deployments ensure desired replica states, Services enable internal communication, and Ingress manages external access. Helm charts or Kustomize can be used for configuration management.A CI/CD pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions or Jenkins) automates image builds, tests, and Kubernetes deployments. Monitoring is integrated using Prometheus and Grafana, while logging is handled via Fluentd and Elasticsearch.The final implementation results in a robust, self-healing, scalable system with rolling updates and zero downtime deployments, making the application production-ready and easier to maintain across environments.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#DevOpsEngineer hashtag#DevOpsCommunity hashtag#CI_CD hashtag#Automationhashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Dockerhashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#CloudEngineerhashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerInTech hashtag#TechInterviews hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#CI_CD hashtag#Automation hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudEngineer hashtag#ThankYou hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#TechCommunity

A Kubernetes project typically involves containerizing an application and deploying it on a Kubernetes cluster for better scalability, resilience, and automation. For example, consider a microservices-based e-commerce platform. The project begins by creating Docker images for each microservice (like user, cart, product, and payment). These images are pushed to a container registry.Next, Kubernetes manifests such as Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps, and Ingress are written. Deployments ensure desired replica states, Services enable internal communication, and Ingress manages external access. Helm charts or Kustomize can be used for configuration management.A CI/CD pipeline (e.g., GitHub Actions or Jenkins) automates image builds, tests, and Kubernetes deployments. Monitoring is integrated using Prometheus and Grafana, while logging is handled via Fluentd and Elasticsearch.The final implementation results in a robust, self-healing, scalable system with rolling updates and zero downtime deployments, making the application production-ready and easier to maintain across environments.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#DevOpsEngineer hashtag#DevOpsCommunity hashtag#CI_CD hashtag#Automationhashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Dockerhashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#CloudEngineerhashtag#InterviewTips hashtag#CareerInTech hashtag#TechInterviews hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TechCareers hashtag#CI_CD hashtag#Automation hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#Kubernetes hashtag#Docker hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudEngineer hashtag#ThankYou hashtag#ProfessionalGrowth hashtag#TechCommunity
